question: an influential religion to enter china along the silk route during the han dynasty was
api_result: Buddhism was the influential religion that entered China along the Silk Road during the Han Dynasty. It is believed to have been introduced into China from India around the 1st century AD, and it gradually gained popularity through the efforts of translators and missionaries who traveled along the Silk Road. This introduction had a profound impact on Chinese culture, philosophy, and art for centuries to come.
